author: Staff Reporter
text:
With the demand for eggs across the country continue to fall, the wholesale price of egg has dropped by 14 paise to be fixed at Rs. 3.20 here on Monday.

Consumption

Officials at the National Egg Coordination Committee (NECC), Namakkal Zone, said that the wholesale price of egg had dropped by 13 paise on February 27 due to drop in consumption.

Though production remains the same, the drop in price continues and the situation is expected till May. On February 1, the wholesale price of egg was Rs. 4. But the price dropped to Rs. 3.70 on February 6 and to Rs. 3.52 on February 25.
title: Wholesale price of egg drops further
